Error Rate Trade-offs:
│ High α (e.g., 10%) │ Low α (e.g., 1%) ─────────┼────────────────────────┼──────────────────────── Pros │ • More discoveries │ • Fewer false positives │ • Shorter experiments │ • Higher confidence in │ • Lower Type II error │ shipped changes ─────────┼────────────────────────┼──────────────────────── Cons │ • More false positives │ • More false negatives │ • Lower confidence │ • Longer experiments │ • Wasted engineering │ • Missed opportunities ─────────┼────────────────────────┼──────────────────────── Best For │ • Early stage companies│ • Mature products │ • Low-cost experiments │ • High-stakes changes │ • Exploratory work │ • Revenue-impacting
Recommended Settings: ┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐ │ Standard A/B Test: α = 0.05, β = 0.20 (Power = 80%) │ │ High-stakes Test: α = 0.01, β = 0.10 (Power = 90%) │ │ Exploratory Test: α = 0.10, β = 0.20 (Power = 80%) │ └─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
